program_name: Austin Energy Power Partner Thermostat Program
description: The Power Partner Thermostat Program is a voluntary demand response program for residential customers and small businesses with smart thermostats. During peak demand periods (typically hot summer afternoons), Austin Energy remotely adjusts enrolled thermostats by a few degrees to reduce electricity demand and strain on the grid. This is distinct from Austin Energy's Commercial Demand Response Program, which is for larger commercial/industrial facilities and involves broader load reduction strategies beyond just thermostats.

service_territories: City of Austin and surrounding service area

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: The Power Partner Thermostat Program is open to both residential customers (homeowners and renters) and small business customers. Commercial eligibility appears limited to small businesses with standard air conditioning systems. Larger commercial and industrial customers should participate in the separate Commercial Demand Response Program ($50-80/kW) rather than the Power Partner Thermostat Program.

additional_requirements: Must have Austin Energy-approved communicating smart thermostat
Must have standard air conditioning system (split system, package unit, or heat pump)
Air conditioning equipment must be in good mechanical condition
For commercial: Must provide tonnage of standard air conditioning system
Landlords cannot enroll rental property devices (renters and homeowners eligible)

notification.notes: Events are initiated remotely through the smart thermostat platform. Customers receive notifications through their thermostat app and can override adjustments at any time without penalty.

capacity_rate.notes: Customers receive $50 bill credit per eligible thermostat upon enrollment

performance_rate.notes: Annual recurring payment of $25 per thermostat for remaining enrolled in the program

penalty_structure.penalty_description: No penalties for non-performance. Customers can override events at any time without penalty. Customers can opt out of the program permanently without penalty.

bonus_payments.conditions: For purchasing and installing a new eligible smart thermostat (residential customers only)
For purchasing and installing a new eligible smart thermostat within 90 days of purchase (commercial customers only)

total_annual_value_per_thermostat.notes: Residential: $50 enrollment + $25 annual + $30 rebate = $105 first year, $25/year thereafter. Commercial: $50 enrollment + $25 annual + $50 rebate = $125 first year, $25/year thereafter.

seasons.notes: Primary season for Power Partner events. Maximum 3 events per week during this period.
Events may be called during winter and extreme weather circumstances, but are less frequent. No specific event limits documented for off-peak season.

call_windows.notes: Typical event window is 3:00-6:00 p.m. on non-holiday weekdays during summer. Events last two hours within this window.

thermostat_adjustment_details.notes: Thermostat adjusted UP by up to 4 degrees during events (reducing cooling). Pre-cooling of 2 degrees occurs 30 minutes before event to minimize customer discomfort.

event_parameters.event_trigger_conditions: Events occur on days of high community energy use or during emergency conditions. Typically called on hot summer days when electricity demand spikes.

enrollment_period.notes: Open enrollment on first-come, first-served basis. Rebate offer good through December 31, 2025 or while funds are available. Funding is limited and available only to Austin Energy customers on a first-come, first-served basis.

special_attributes: Voluntary participation with no penalties for opt-out
Part of Austin Energy's broader Power Partner program family (includes EV charging program)
Supports Austin Energy's 270 MW demand response target by 2035
Contributes to Austin Energy's 100% carbon-free energy goal by 2035

program_evolution.change_description: Predecessor voluntary residential load control program began
December 2012: Power Partner Thermostat Program pilot announced with ecobee partnership. Initial enrollment phase completed with $85 rebate per thermostat.
Official launch of Power Partner Thermostat Program. Full rollout after pilot phase.
June 2024: Power Partner program expanded to include EV charging program, marking diversification of the Power Partner brand beyond thermostats.
Current program structure: $50 enrollment + $25 annual payments. Purchase rebates of $30 (residential) or $50 (commercial) available through December 31, 2025.

program_history.notes: Program has evolved from initial $85 rebate structure (2012 pilot) to current $50 enrollment + $25 annual + rebate structure. Program platform managed by EnergyHub with multiple thermostat manufacturers eligible.

relationship_to_other_programs.description: Austin Energy operates multiple demand response programs targeting different customer segments

related_programs.relationship: Separate program for larger commercial/industrial customers
key_differences: CDR: $50-80 per kW saved vs Power Partner: $50 enrollment + $25/year per thermostat
CDR: 20 kW minimum reduction vs Power Partner: no minimum capacity
CDR: Manual facility-wide load reduction vs Power Partner: Automated thermostat control
CDR: Broader load reduction strategies vs Power Partner: HVAC-only
CDR: Advanced metering required vs Power Partner: Smart thermostat required
CDR: Cannot use generators vs Power Partner: N/A
related_programs.customer_guidance: Large commercial/industrial customers should participate in Commercial DR ($50-80/kW). Small businesses with standard HVAC can participate in Power Partner thermostats.

related_programs.relationship: Sister program under Power Partner brand
related_programs.key_details: Same incentive structure ($50 enrollment + $25 annual) for EV charger management during peak demand periods (2-7 p.m., June-September, max 15 events/month)

data_sources.source_name: Austin Energy Power Partner Thermostat Program (Commercial)
data_sources.verified_data: Enrollment incentives ($50 + $50 rebate), annual incentives ($25), event timing (June 1-Sept 30, 3-6pm), event duration (up to 2 hours), thermostat adjustment (up to 4 degrees), event frequency limits (max 3/week, 25/year), opt-out policy, eligibility requirements
Incentive amounts ($50 enrollment, $25 annual, $30 rebate), event schedule, thermostat adjustments, pre-cooling details (2 degrees, 30 minutes before), enrollment requirements, 5 thermostat limit

data_sources.source_name: Austin Energy Commercial Demand Response Program
data_sources.verified_data: Commercial DR payment structure ($50-80/kW), eligibility requirements (20 kW minimum), event parameters (June-Sept, 1-7pm, 30-min or 10-min notice), program distinctions from Power Partner

data_sources.source_name: Austin Energy Demand Response Expansion Announcement
data_sources.verified_data: 270 MW demand response target by 2035, 195 City buildings enrolled, 6 MW potential from government facilities, program goals and context

data_sources.source_name: EnergyHub Press Release - Austin Energy Enrollment Completion
data_sources.verified_data: Initial program structure (2012), $85 rebate, enrollment timeline, program goals, EnergyHub platform role

data_sources.source_name: ecobee Press Release - Power Partner Launch
data_sources.verified_data: Program pilot launch date (December 6, 2012), initial rebate structure ($85), program objectives

data_sources.source_name: Austin Energy Power Partner EV Program Launch
data_sources.verified_data: Power Partner brand expansion to EVs, consistent incentive structure across Power Partner programs

integration_metadata.notes: Data quality is high with comprehensive verification from official Austin Energy sources. All payment structures, eligibility requirements, and event parameters confirmed through multiple official sources. Program is NOT suitable for battery optimization - it is a thermostat-only demand response program for residential and small business customers. Battery/BESS operators should investigate the separate Commercial Demand Response Program instead.

battery_suitability.reason: Power Partner Thermostat Program is exclusively for HVAC load control via smart thermostats. Battery energy storage systems should participate in Austin Energy's Commercial Demand Response Program ($50-80/kW) or directly in ERCOT wholesale markets.
alternative_programs: Austin Energy Commercial Demand Response Program (for behind-the-meter BESS)
ERCOT wholesale energy and ancillary services markets

research_summary.researcher_notes: Comprehensive research conducted across official Austin Energy sources, press releases, and program documentation. Key findings: (1) Power Partner Thermostat Program is distinct from Commercial Demand Response Program - they serve different customer segments with different payment structures. (2) Power Partner is part of a broader brand that now includes EV charging program launched in 2024. (3) Program launched in 2013 with pilot in late 2012, has evolved from $85 rebate to current $50 enrollment + $25 annual + rebate structure. (4) Program is one component of Austin Energy's broader strategy to achieve 270 MW of demand response by 2035 and 100% carbon-free energy by 2035. (5) Program managed by EnergyHub platform, supports multiple thermostat manufacturers. (6) Strong customer protections: no penalties, override capability, voluntary opt-out. (7) Not suitable for BESS - exclusively for thermostat-based HVAC control.
research_summary.verification_status: VERIFIED - All key program parameters confirmed through official Austin Energy sources
research_summary.data_integrity_confirmation: All data points verified through multiple official sources. No data invented. Payment structures, event parameters, eligibility requirements, and program history all confirmed through primary sources (Austin Energy official website, press releases, and program documentation).
research_summary.program_clarification:
CRITICAL: Power Partner Thermostat Program is NOT the same as Commercial Demand Response Program. These are two separate programs:

**Power Partner Thermostat:** $50 enrollment + $25/year per thermostat. For residential and small business customers with smart thermostats. Automated HVAC control during events.

**Commercial Demand Response:** $50-80 per kW saved. For larger commercial/industrial customers. Requires 20+ kW reduction. Manual facility-wide load reduction strategies.

Battery operators should investigate Commercial DR or ERCOT wholesale markets, NOT Power Partner thermostats.
recommended_next_steps: For residential/small business thermostat participants: Enroll at https://www.thermostatrewards.com/austin-energy/ or contact AEpowerpartner@austinenergy.com
For commercial BESS operators: Contact loadcoop@austinenergy.com or call 512-494-9400 to inquire about Commercial Demand Response Program eligibility
For commercial facilities: Request no-cost assessment to determine if Commercial DR program is appropriate
Check if program rebates still available (funding is limited, first-come first-served through December 31, 2025)
For large BESS: Investigate ERCOT wholesale market participation options

general_commercial.contact_method: Can also reach out to assigned Austin Energy Key Account Manager
